conclusion: The charged bead arrives at point B in the horizontal plane containing B, M, and N.
The distances to M and N are both equal to the side length of the equilateral triangle, L.
The magnitudes of the forces exerted by the two fixed charges on the bead are F_M = k q Q / L² toward M and F_N = k q Q / L² away from N, i.e., toward M.
Because the forces are equal in magnitude and directed along the same line (B → M), they add directly.
The net electric force magnitude on the bead at B is F = 2 k q Q / L².
